comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to www.navsource.org/archives/01/28a.htm "Captain John Hood was the Commanding Officer of the battleship Delaware (BB-28) in 1911-1912. Under his command the Delaware won the battle efficiency pennant during this period." A copy of this picture is used. books.google.com/books?id=9ZSlyS7MrzAC&pg=RA1-PA264&a... indicates that he commanded the USS Texas in January 1916. Which is confirmed by www.navsource.org/archives/01/35e.htm "Captain John Hood was the Commanding Officer of the battleship Texas (BB-35) deck in 1915-1916. During his command the Texas won the "Red E" for excellence in engineering efficiency. "

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of May 25, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0D1FF83B5F13738... has him as a member of the "General Board of the Navy." He had 'prepared for the United States Navy League a plan of naval policy which he calls a "Practical Guarantee of Peace." '
